Subject: Improved Expand Effective Membership analysis task on SG_LocalAdmins to retain previous successful collection of each host
Description: A custom had mentioned on a project that they would occasionally get RPC errors here and there on some hosts (they are scanning 1000 hosts at least daily but usually more than once a day), and the SA_SG_LocalAdmins_Details table would drop the hosts completely for any that had issues on the most recent collection. This meant we had to wait for it to run again (and hopefully succeed the next time) which it usually would and pull in the same data we had already collected before. I've changed the analysis task on the job to better handle this and retain the previous successful host audit even if it were to fail for one of them on a recent run it would still show the most recent successful info we have for that host. I think this would be a good addition/change to the existing job in the product. I've attached the job from my lab (I've left the previous out-the-box analysis there unchecked and labeled it as old.
DevOps_Steps_to_Reproduce__c:
1. Run SG_LocalAdmins
2. Receive successful collection on hosts
- SA_SG_LocalAdmins_Details table shows all information collected for each host
3. Run SG_LocalAdmins to check if there were any changes to group membership
4. Receive an error on some of the hosts with connecting for that run
- SA_SG_LocalAdmins_Details table only shows information on hosts that were successful and drops all other host data
What_We_Know__c: Development was able to get a fix completed for this issue and it has been packaged into the latest version of NEA v11.6.0.133
Next_Steps__c: Upgrade to latest version of NEA v11.6.0.133+
Solution_Comment__c: A custom job was delivered to the customer at the time of the issue which resolved the problem for them. A fix was also made public in NEA v11.6.0.133+
